title: Why Chip Controls are a Bad Idea

rawLines.text: AI promise and Chip precariousness was
published on Tuesday February 25th
2025 yesterday anthropic released quad
Sonet 3.7 Dylan Patel had the joke of
the day about anthropic seeming aversion
to the number four which means die in
Chinese anthropic is also a Chinese AI
company because of their aversion to the
number four Jokes Aside the correction
on this post by Ethan mollik suggests
that anthropic did not increment the
main version number because Sonet 3 3.7
is still in the GPT 4 class of models as
far as computer is concerned after
publishing this piece I was contacted by
anthropic who told me that Sonet 3.7
would not be considered a 10 to the 26th
flop model and cost a few tens of
millions of dollars to train the future
models would be much bigger I updated
the post with that information the only
significant change is that Claude 3 is
now referred to as an advanced model but
not a gen 3 Model I love mik's work but
reject his neutral naming scheme whoever
gets to a generation first deserves the
honor of the name in other words if Gen
2 models are GPT 4 class then gen 3
models are grock 3 class and whereas
Sonet 3.7 is an evolution of son 3.5s
fascinating mixture of personality and
coding prowess likely a result of some
anthropic special softs and post
trainining grock 3 feels like a model
that is the result of a step order
increase in compute capacity with a much
lighter layer of reinforcement learning
with human feedback RF its answers are
far more in-depth and detailed model
good but frequently becomes Tu verbose
rhf lacking it gets math problems right
model good but its explanations are
harder to follow rhf lacking it is also
much more willing to generate forbidden
content from arotica to bomb recipes
while having on the surface the
political sensibilities of Tumblr with
something more akin to forchan under the
surface if you prod footnote this
suggests a surprising takeaway it's
possible that will rhf on chat GPT
especially quad block off the 4chan
elements they also T down the Tumblr
Elements which is to say the politics
don't come from the post training but
from the data set I.E the internet in
other words if I'm right about grock 3
having a much lighter layer of rhf then
that explains both the surface politics
and what is available under the surface
end footnote grock 3 more than any model
yet feels like the distilled Internet
it's my favorite so far grock 3 is also
a reminder of how much speed matters and
by extension why base models are still
important in a world of AI that reason
grock 3 is tangibly faster than the
competition which is a better user
experience more generally conversation
is the realm of quick widths not deep
thinkers the latter is who I want doing
research or other agentic type tasks the
former makes for a better consumer user
experience in a chatbot or voice
interface chat GPT meanwhile still has
the best product experience its Mac app
in particular is dramatically better
than quads footnote grock doesn't yet
have a Mac app but its iPhone app is
very good and footnote and it handles
more more consumer use cases like math
homework in a much more user-friendly
way deep research meanwhile is
significantly better than all of its
competitors including grock's deep
search and for me anyways the closest
experience yet to AGI open ai's biggest
asset however is the chat jpt brand and
Associated mind share coo Brad lightcap
just told CNBC that the service had
surpassed 400 million weekly active
users a 33% increase in less than 3
months open AI is as I declared 4 months
after the release of chat GPT The
Accidental consumer tech company
consumer tech companies are the hardest
to build and have the potential to be
the most valuable they also require a
completely different culture and value
chain than a research organization with
an API on the side that is the
fundamental reality that I suspect has
driven much of the open a upheaval over
the last 2 and A2 years longtime openi
employees didn't sign up to be the next
Google search or meta nor is Microsoft
interested in being a mere component
supplier to a company that must own the
consumer relationship to succeed in fact
though open AI has moved too slowly the
company should absolutely have an ad
supported version by now no matter how
much the very idea might make AI
researchers skin crawl one of the
takeaways from the deep seek phenomenon
was how many consumers didn't understand
how good open ai's best models were
because they were not paying customers
it is very much an open eyes competitive
interest to make it cost effective to
give free users the best models and that
means advertising more importantly the
only way for a consumer tech company to
truly scale to the entire world is by
having an ad model which maximizes the
addressable Market while still making it
possible to continually increase the
average revenue per user this doesn't
foreclose a subscription model of course
indeed ads plus subscriptions is the
ultimate destination for a consumer
content business deep seek meanwhile has
both been the biggest Story of the Year
in part because it is the yin to grock
3's Ying deep seeks V3 and R1 models are
excellent and worthy competitors in the
GPT 4 class and they achiev this
Excellence through extremely impressive
engineering on both the infrastructure
and model layers grock 3 on the other
hand simply bought the most
top-of-the-line Nvidia chips leveraging
the company's networking to build the
biggest Computing cluster yet and came
out with a model that is better but not
astronomically so the fact that deep
seek is Chinese is critically important
for reasons I will get to below but it
is just as important that it is an Open
Lab regularly publishing papers full
model weights and underlying source code
deep seeks models which are both better
than meta's llama models and more open
and unencumbered by an open-ish license
set the bar for min minimum open
capability any model at or below deep
seeks models has no real excuse to not
be open safety concerns are moot when
you can just run deep seek while
competitive concerns are dwarfed by the
sacrifice in uptake and interest
entailed in having a model that is both
worse and closed both deep- seek and
llama meanwhile provide significant
pressure on pricing API costs in both
the US and China have come down in
response to the Chinese research lab's
releases and the only way to have a
sustainable margin in the long run is to
either have a cost advantage in
infrastructure I Google have a
sustainable model capability Advantage
potentially quad encoding or be an
aggregator which is what open AI ought
to pursue with chat
GPT the state of AI chips all this is
but for those with high PE Doom concerns
great news AI at the moment seems to be
in a Goldilocks position there is
sufficient incentive for the leading
research labs to raise money and
continue investing in New Foundation
models in the hope of building an AI
that improves itself even as competition
drives API prices down relentlessly
further incentivizing model makers to
come up with differentiated products and
capabilities the biggest winner of
course continues to be Nvidia whose
chips are Fab by tsmc Deep seek success
is causing Chinese demand for the H20
nvidia's reduced compute and reduced
bandwidth to abide by expert controls
version of the h200 to Skyrocket even as
xai just demonstrated that the fastest
way to compete is to pay for the best
chips deep seeks Innovations will make
other models more efficient but it's
reasonable to argue that those
efficiencies are Downstream from the
chip bam and that it's understandable by
companies who can just buy the best
chips haven't pursued but will certainly
borrow similar gains the latter point is
a problem for AMD in particular semi
analysis published a brutal breakdown
late last year demonstrating just how
poor the Nvidia competitor software is
relative to its Hardware AMD promises to
do better but frankly great chips
limited by poor software has been the
story of AMD for its entire five Decades
of existence some companies like meow or
Microsoft might put in the work to write
better software but leading Labs don't
have the time nor expertise the story is
different for Huawei and its Ascend line
of AI chips those chips are fabed on
China's semiconductor manufacturing
International corporations SMI 7 anomet
process using Western built deep
ultraviolet lithography duv and quad
patterning that this is possible isn't a
surprise but it's reasonable to assume
that the Fab won't progress further
without developing extreme ultraviolet
lithography euv and no calling an
evolution of the 7 nomer process 5.5
nomers doesn't count still the primary
limitation for AI chips particularly
when it comes to inference isn't
necessarily chip speed but rather memory
bandwidth and that can be improved at
the current process level moreover one
way to somewhat overcome the necessity
of using less efficient chips is to
Simply build more data centers with more
power something that China is much
better at than the US most importantly
however is that China's tech companies
have the motivation and the software
chops to make the Ascend a viable
Contender particularly for inference
there's one more player who should be
mentioned alongside Nvidia tsmc and
Huawei SMI and that is the hyperscalers
who design their own chips either on
their own AWS with tranium and Microsoft
with Maya or in collaboration with
broadcom Google with tpus and meta with
mtia the capabilities and importance of
these efforts varies Google has been
investing in tpus for a decade now and
trains its own models on them while the
Next Generation anthropic model is being
trained on tranium meta's mtia is about
recommendations and not generative AI
while Microsoft's Maya is a much more
nassin effort but what they all have in
common is that their chips are fabbed by
tsmc tsmc and Intel that tsmc is
dominant isn't necessarily a surprise
yes much has been written including on
this site about Intel stumbles in tsmc's
Rise but even if intel had managed to
stay on the Leading Edge and ATA is
looking promising there is still the
matter of the company needing to
transform itself from an integrated
device manufacturer IDM who designs and
makes its own chips to a Foundry that
has the customer service IP library and
experience to make chips for third
parties like all the entities I just
discussed Nvidia to take a pertinent
example was making its chips at tsmc and
Samsung even when Intel had the leading
process indeed it was the creation of
tsmc and its Pure Play Foundry model
that even made Nvidia possible footnote
although nvidia's first chip was made by
SGS Thompson microelectronics and
footnote this also means that tsmc
doesn't just have Leading Edge capacity
but trailing Edge capacity as well there
are a lot of chips in the world both on
AI servers and also in everything from
Cars to stereos to refrigerators that
don't need to be on The Cutting Edge and
which benefit from the low costs
afforded by the fully depreciated
foundaries tsmc still maintains mostly
in Taiwan and tsmc in turn can take that
cash flow along with increasing prices
for the Leading Edge and invest in new
Fabs on The Cutting Edge those Leading
Edge Fabs continue to Skyrocket in price
which means volume is critical that is
why it was clear to me back when this
site started in 2013 that that Intel
needed to become a Foundry unfortunately
the company didn't follow my advice
preferring to see their stock price sore
on the back of Cloud Server demand fast
forward to 2021 in Intel now no longer
on the Leading Edge and with its Cloud

resurgent AMD on tsmc Superior process
tried under the tutelage of Pat Ginger
to become a Foundry unfortunately the
company's diminishing cast position is
larger than its Foundry customer base
which is mostly experimental chips or
x86 variants Intel's core problem goes
back to the observation above becoming a
Foundry is about more than having the
Leading Edge process Intel might have
been able to develop those skills in
conjunction with customers eager to be
on the best process in the world but
once Intel didn't even have that it had
nothing to offer they're simply is no
reason for an apple or AMD or Nvidia to
take the massive risk entailed in
working with Intel when tsmc is an
option China and a changing world tsmc
is of course headquartered in Taiwan
that is where the company's R&D and
Leading Edge Fabs are located along with
most of its trailing Edge capacity smick
obviously is in China another Foundry is
Samsung in South Korea I told this story
as to why so much of this industry ended
up in Asia last fall in a chance to
build quote semi-conductors are so
integral to the history of Silicon
Valley that they give the region its
name and more importantly its culture
chips require huge amounts of upfront

most other manufactured goods minimal
marginal costs this econom IC reality
helped Drive the development of the
Venture Capital model which provided
unencumbered startup Capital to
companies who could earn theoretically
unlimited returns at scale this model
worked even better with software which
was perfectly replicable that history
starts in 1956 when William Shockley
founded the shakle semiconductor
laboratory to commercialize the
transistor that he had helped event at
Bell Labs he chose Mountain View to be
close to his aiing mother a year later
the so-called traitorous 8 led by Robert
no left and founded Fairchild
semiconductor down the road 6 years
after that Fairchild semiconductor
opened a facility in Hong Kong to
assemble and test semiconductors
assembly required manually attaching
wires to a semiconductor chip a labor
intensive and monotonous task that was
difficult to do economically with
American wages which ran about $2.50 per
hour Hong Kong wages were a tenth of
that 4 years later Texas Instruments
open a facility in Taiwan where wages
were 19 cents an hour 2 years after that
Fairchild semiconductor opened another
facility in Singapore where wages were
11 cents an hour in other words you can
make the case that the classic story of
Silicon Valley isn't completely honest
chips did have marginal costs but that
marginal cost was within singled digigit
years of the founding of Silicon Valley
exported to Asia end quote I recounted
in that article about how this
Outsourcing was an intentional policy of
the US government and launched into a
broader discussion about the post-war
Pax Americana Global Order that placed

and why that led to an inevitable

the rise of a country in China that in

anyways is how one might frame many of
the signals coming out of the second

and well a perhaps Tamer approach to

Trump's rhetoric on the campaign Trail
one possibility is that Trump is

and it's better for the US to

have it forced upon them
the important takeaway that is relevant
to this article is that Taiwan is the
flasho in both scenarios a pivot to Asia

is about potentially granting or

at the same time Taiwan has not declared

without endorsing either that position

Taiwanese do in my experience handle

only make this need even more pressing

end quote I added 2 years later after

is the same a microprocessor nearly
every step of the process is different

different dimensions with different

lines can be organized differently to
serve different approaches to
lithography chemicals are tuned to

how exactly they are prepared and
applied sure most of the equipment could

the best you could hope for is that tsmc
